Package io.anserini.collection

Class DocumentCollection<T extends SourceDocument>

java.lang.Object
io.anserini.collection.DocumentCollection<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<FileSegment<T>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
CarCollection, ClueWeb09Collection, ClueWeb12Collection, CoreCollection, HtmlCollection, JsonCollection, NewYorkTimesCollection, TrecCollection, TrecwebCollection, TweetCollection, WashingtonPostCollection, WikipediaCollection
public abstract class DocumentCollection<T extends SourceDocument>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<FileSegment<T>>

A static collection of documents, comprised of one or more FileSegments. Each FileSegment is a container for SourceDocuments. A collection is assumed to be a directory. In the case where the collection is a single file (e.g., a Wikipedia dump), place the file into an arbitrary directory.

The collection is responsible for discovering files with qualified names in the input directory. The file segment implementation is responsible for reading each file to generate SourceDocuments for indexing.

The steps of adding a new collection class are:

  1. Create a subclass for DocumentCollection.
  2. Implement class FileSegment, by convention as an inner class of the DocumentCollection. See TrecCollection.Segment as an example.
  3. Create a subclass for SourceDocument implementing the corresponding document type. See TrecCollection.Document as an example.
  4. Optionally create a new LuceneDocumentGenerator. The LuceneDocumentGenerator.createDocument(T) method takes SourceDocument as the input and return a Lucene Document for indexing.
  5. Remember to add unit tests at src/test/java/io/anserini/collection!
